title: Scientific Inquiry-Based Small Group Discussion Design to Improve Accessibility and Equity in Online Teacher Training Programs

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific concepts (experimental design, variable control, data analysis) with intermediate-level application skills (simple hypothesis formulation and evidence collection)
context.additional_context: Targets learners aiming to become elementary science teachers in mobile-based learning environments using digital devices. Emphasizes relationship-building and collaborative problem-solving skills. Particularly focuses on cultivating instructional design abilities through the scientific inquiry process (observation → hypothesis → experimentation → analysis → conclusion).

learning_goals: Learners identify 3 accessibility barriers in science education environments (e.g., lack of lab tools, digital divide, language limitations) via online small-group discussions and propose solutions using scientific inquiry methods.

Learners apply a relationship-centered discussion model (pair-squad debate) to draft a fair science class design framework reflecting multicultural learners’ backgrounds within 4 weeks, meeting ≥4 of 5 peer evaluation rubric items (experimental design, variable control, evidence-based conclusions).

Learners revise ≥2 core elements (e.g., learning objectives, lab assessment methods, inquiry activities) of a science curriculum design based on ≥3 peer feedbacks and submit the revised draft meeting rubric criteria (clarity, feasibility, effectiveness) at ≥3 points (5-point scale).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
